DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Data Domain Blood Specimen Collection Tube Device Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the type of collection tube used for a blood sample.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Data Domain Blood Specimen Collection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to laboratory data._A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood._A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to laboratory data.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to laboratory data.

Property.preferredDefinition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

Concepts.definition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._Any device or component shaped like a hollow cylinder._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solution of citric acid, sodium citrate, and dextrose used as an anticoagulant in the collection and preservation of whole blood.

Concepts.definition: A solution of citric acid, sodium citrate, and dextrose used as an anticoagulant in the collection and preservation of whole blood.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A proprietary blood collection tube designed for venous blood collection, containing EDTA anticoagulant and a cell preservative. The EDTA absorbs calcium ions, which prevents the blood from clotting. The preservative preserves the morphology and cell surface antigen expression of the epithelial cells and leukocytes. This blood collection tube has been used for the preservation of circulating tumor cells and lymphocyte subsets.

Concepts.definition: A proprietary blood collection tube designed for venous blood collection, containing EDTA anticoagulant and a cell preservative. The EDTA absorbs calcium ions, which prevents the blood from clotting. The preservative preserves the morphology and cell surface antigen expression of the epithelial cells and leukocytes. This blood collection tube has been used for the preservation of circulating tumor cells and lymphocyte subsets.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A shape whose base is a circle and whose sides taper up to a point.: A hollow cylinder, especially one for holding or conveying liquids; anything shaped like such a hollow cylinder, e.g. an organic structure having the shape or function of a tube such as channel within a plant or animal body (e.g. fallopian tube).

Concepts.definition: A shape whose base is a circle and whose sides taper up to a point.

A hollow cylinder, especially one for holding or conveying liquids; anything shaped like such a hollow cylinder, e.g. an organic structure having the shape or function of a tube such as channel within a plant or animal body (e.g. fallopian tube).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The acid form of edetate, a chelating agent with anti-hypercalcemic and anticoagulant properties. Edetic acid binds calcium and heavy metal ions, forming soluble stable complexes which are readily excreted by the kidneys. This results in a decrease in serum calcium levels. This agent is also used as an anticoagulant for blood specimens and is applied as a treatment of lead poisoning.

Concepts.definition: The acid form of edetate, a chelating agent with anti-hypercalcemic and anticoagulant properties. Edetic acid binds calcium and heavy metal ions, forming soluble stable complexes which are readily excreted by the kidneys. This results in a decrease in serum calcium levels. This agent is also used as an anticoagulant for blood specimens and is applied as a treatment of lead poisoning.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.13 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002119. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An element with atomic symbol Li, atomic number 3, and atomic weight 6.941.: A sulfur-rich glycosaminoglycan with anticoagulant property. Heparin binds to antithrombin III to form a heparin-antithrombin III complex. The complex binds to and irreversibly inactivates thrombin and other activated clotting factors, such as factors IX, X, XI, and XII, thereby preventing the polymerization of fibrinogen to fibrin and the subsequent formation of clots.

Concepts.definition: An element with atomic symbol Li, atomic number 3, and atomic weight 6.941.

A sulfur-rich glycosaminoglycan with anticoagulant property. Heparin binds to antithrombin III to form a heparin-antithrombin III complex. The complex binds to and irreversibly inactivates thrombin and other activated clotting factors, such as factors IX, X, XI, and XII, thereby preventing the polymerization of fibrinogen to fibrin and the subsequent formation of clots.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to genomic DNA isolation.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to genomic DNA isolation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to isolation of cellular RNA.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to isolation of cellular RNA.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A top (as for a bottle).: A small, often stoppered glass or plastic bottle for holding fluids.: A fastener device with a tapered threaded shaft and a head designed to engage a drive device.

Concepts.definition: A top (as for a bottle).
A small, often stoppered glass or plastic bottle for holding fluids.
A fastener device with a tapered threaded shaft and a head designed to engage a drive device.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An alkali metal with atomic number 11, atomic weight 23, atomic symbol Na and is used in the manufacture of esters, and preparation of organic compounds, including medicinals.  The ion form is involved in many physiologic preocesses, including blood pressure regulation and electrolyte balance.: A sulfur-rich glycosaminoglycan with anticoagulant property. Heparin binds to antithrombin III to form a heparin-antithrombin III complex. The complex binds to and irreversibly inactivates thrombin and other activated clotting factors, such as factors IX, X, XI, and XII, thereby preventing the polymerization of fibrinogen to fibrin and the subsequent formation of clots.

Concepts.definition: An element with atomic symbol Na, atomic number 11, and atomic weight 23.

A sulfur-rich glycosaminoglycan with anticoagulant property. Heparin binds to antithrombin III to form a heparin-antithrombin III complex. The complex binds to and irreversibly inactivates thrombin and other activated clotting factors, such as factors IX, X, XI, and XII, thereby preventing the polymerization of fibrinogen to fibrin and the subsequent formation of clots.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube that contains a gel that separates blood cells from serum.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube that contains a gel that separates blood cells from serum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

This agent is also used as an anticoagulant for blood specimens and is applied as a treatment of lead poisoning.: Any device or component shaped like a hollow cylinder.

This agent is also used as an anticoagulant for blood specimens and is applied as a treatment of lead poisoning.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: DNA Without Cell Blood Collection Tube

ValueMeaning.preferredName: DNA Without Cell Blood Collection Tube
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.: Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.: A test tube, capillary tube, or other tube designed for the collection of blood.

Concepts.definition: A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.
Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.
The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
A test tube, capillary tube, or other tube designed for the collection of blood.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Urine cup

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Ribonucleic Acid Preservation PAXgene Blood RNA Tube

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Ribonucleic Acid Preservation PAXgene Blood RNA Tube
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Single-stranded long chain of nucleotides containing ribose. It is the end product of DNA transcription by the enzyme RNA polymerase. It is essential in protein synthesis.: The activity of protecting something from loss or danger; a process that saves organic substances from decay; to maintain or keep intact.: A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to isolation of cellular RNA.

Concepts.definition: Single-stranded long chain of nucleotides containing ribose. It is the end product of DNA transcription by the enzyme RNA polymerase. It is essential in protein synthesis.
The activity of protecting something from loss or danger; a process that saves organic substances from decay; to maintain or keep intact.
A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to isolation of cellular RNA.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The hue of the long-wave end of the visible spectrum, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 630 to 750 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation and whose hue resembles that of blood: The uppermost part, side, or surface of something.: Any device or component shaped like a hollow cylinder.

Concepts.definition: The hue of the long-wave end of the visible spectrum, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 630 to 750 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation and whose hue resembles that of blood
The uppermost part, side, or surface of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Container or tube to collect cerebrospinal fluid sample.

A glycosaminoglycan anticoagulant that binds to antithrombin III to form a heparin-antithrombin III complex. The complex binds to and irreversibly inactivates thrombin and other activated clotting factors IX, X, XI, and XII and prevents the transformation of fibrinogen to fibrin. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: A sulfur-rich glycosaminoglycan with anticoagulant property. Heparin binds to antithrombin III to form a heparin-antithrombin III complex. The complex binds to and irreversibly inactivates thrombin and other activated clotting factors, such as factors IX, X, XI, and XII, thereby preventing the polymerization of fibrinogen to fibrin and the subsequent formation of clots.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Eight To Ten Milliliter Green Top Tube
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 7 and less than 9 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of seven and one._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._A natural number greater than 9 and less than 11 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of nine and one._A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume._The hue of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between yellow and blue, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 490 to 570 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation and whose hue is that of the emerald or somewhat less yellow than that of growing grass._A blood collection tube used for the collection of whole blood.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 7 and less than 9 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of seven and one.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
A natural number greater than 9 and less than 11 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of nine and one.
A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume.

The hue of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between yellow and blue, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 490 to 570 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation and whose hue is that of the emerald or somewhat less yellow than that of growing grass.
A blood collection tube used for the collection of whole blood.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube with a formaldehyde-free preservative which stabilizes nucleated blood cells, preventing the release of genomic DNA, and allowing isolation of high-quality cell-free DNA.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube with a formaldehyde-free preservative which stabilizes nucleated blood cells, preventing the release of genomic DNA, and allowing isolation of high-quality cell-free DNA.
